newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Canberra names preferred bidder for airport.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Canberra names preferred bidder for airport.

text.p: Australia on Tuesday selected Foxerco Pty Ltd as preferred bidder for government-owned Avalon airport, about 50 km southwest of Melbourne.
Defence Minister Ian McLachlan also announced the closure of government's Avalon-based aircraft maintenance service, ASTAAS Pty Ltd.

The government will now begin sales negotiations with Foxerco, a joint venture between transport and distribution company Linfox Transport (Australia) Pty Ltd and aviation concern Serco Aviation Services Pty Ltd, Finance Minister John Fahey said in a joint statement with McLachlan.
Avalon airport is home to a range of domestic and international pilot training programmes and several defence industries and is the venue for biennial international airshows.

McLachlan said the decision to close the loss-making ASTAAS, a subsidiary of the government's Aerospace Technologies of Australia (ASTA), was taken after Canberra failed to find a buyer for the company.
Fahey said that despite several approaches to the private sector, the government had been unable to find any interest.

"The depressed condition of the heavy aircraft maintenance market, particularly for non-airline aligned companies such as ASTAAS, was the major factor contributing to lack of buyer interest," Fahey said.
ASTAAS had accumulated losses of A$32 million to October, 1995, and had received A$15 million in support from the government since July, 1995, he said.
